intro: Micromeria kosaninii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and umbel-like inflorescences that bear yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
